Articles.Content: For the sake of argument, let's assume that I am VERY low on fuel. Is there any tool / window / screen which would help me plan a burn home?

For the sake of argument, let's assume that I am VERY low on fuel. Is there any tool / window / screen which would help me plan a burn home?

If you're on the equator, wait till Kerbin is on the horizon (on the west side I think) and burn straight up. That is retrograde.

If you're on the equator, wait till Kerbin is on the horizon (on the west side I think) and burn straight up. That is retrograde.

This is the least efficient way to get home since it maximizes Gravity Drag.

Best way is to get into a very low orbit (15km or so) and then burn prograde when Kerbin rises (not sets!) over the horizon.

Of course there is a more convenient and effective method. You need the Unity editor (free version is sufficient) and the KSP PartTools package v0.20 or newer. There are threads around the forum describing how to use either. After you get both installed, tell PartTools where your GameData is and it will give you a full list of Internals and Props it finds.

In Ã¢â‚¬Å“SpacesÃ¢â‚¬Â tab, select the Internal you want to edit by pressing "Spawn", and the editor will load the interior with all the props.

In the Ã¢â‚¬Å“PropsÃ¢â‚¬Â tab you will find a list of all the available props. Just press Ã¢â‚¬Å“SpawnÃ¢â‚¬Â on the one you need and it will appear in the scene.

Make sure that all the props you added are below the internal in the Hierarchy, place all the props and click Ã¢â‚¬Å“Save to ConfigÃ¢â‚¬Â.

Run KSP or reload the database, and enjoy.
